       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Paramilitarism_in_Colombia" title="Paramilitarism in Colombia">
        right wing paramilitaries
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HistoricalCommission_107-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-HistoricalCommission-107">
         [103]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The conflict escalated in the 1990s,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Colombian_armed_conflict_108-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Colombian_armed_conflict-108">
         [104]
        </a>
       </sup>
       mainly in remote rural areas.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Colombian_conflict_109-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Colombian_conflict-109">
         [105]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Since the beginning of the armed conflict,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Human_rights_defenders" title="Human rights defenders">
        human rights defenders
       </a>
       have fought for the respect for
       <a href="/wiki/Human_rights" title="Human rights">
        human rights
       </a>
       , despite staggering opposition.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-112">
        <a href="#cite_note-112">
         [Note 5]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-114">
        <a href="#cite_note-114">
         [Note 6]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Several guerrillas' organizations decided to demobilize after peace negotiations in 1989–1994.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Enough_Already!_14-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-Enough_Already!-14">
         [13]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       The United States has been heavily involved in the conflict since its beginnings, when in the early 1960s the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/U.S._government" title="U.S. government">
        U.S. government
       </a>
       encouraged the Colombian military to attack leftist militias in rural Colombia. This was part of the U.S. fight against communism.
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mercenarie" title="Mercenarie">
        Mercenaries
       </a>
       and multinational corporations such as
       <a href="/wiki/Chiquita_Brands_International" title="Chiquita Brands International">
        Chiquita Brands International
       </a>
       are some of the international actors that have contributed to the violence of the conflict.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HistoricalCommission_107-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-HistoricalCommission-107">
         [103]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Enough_Already!_14-2">
        <a href="#cite_note-Enough_Already!-14">
         [13]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-colombia-and-us-54_115-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-colombia-and-us-54-115">
         [109]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       On 4 July 1991, a new
       <a href="/wiki/Colombian_Constitution_of_1991" title="Colombian Constitution of 1991">
        Constitution
       </a>
       was promulgated. The changes generated by the new constitution are viewed as positive by Colombian society.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-116">
        <a href="#cite_note-116">
         [110]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Colombian_Constitution_of_1991_117-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Colombian_Constitution_of_1991-117">
         [111]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="21st_century">
        21st century
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:237px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Jefa_de_Estado_participa_en_ceremonia_de_la_Firma_de_la_Paz_entre_el_Gobierno_de_Colombia_y_las_FARC_E.P._(29953487045).jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2206" data-file-width="3307" height="157" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/Jefa_de_Estado_participa_en_ceremonia_de_la_Firma_de_la_Paz_entre_el_Gobierno_de_Colombia_y_las_FARC_E.P._%2829953487045%29.jpg/235px-Jefa_de_Estado_participa_en_ceremonia_de_la_Firma_de_la_Paz_entre_el_Gobierno_de_Colombia_y_las_FARC_E.P._%2829953487045%29.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/Jefa_de_Estado_participa_en_ceremonia_de_la_Firma_de_la_Paz_entre_el_Gobierno_de_Colombia_y_las_FARC_E.P._%2829953487045%29.jpg/353px-Jefa_de_Estado_participa_en_ceremonia_de_la_Firma_de_la_Paz_entre_el_Gobierno_de_Colombia_y_las_FARC_E.P._%2829953487045%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/Jefa_de_Estado_participa_en_ceremonia_de_la_Firma_de_la_Paz_entre_el_Gobierno_de_Colombia_y_las_FARC_E.P._%2829953487045%29.jpg/470px-Jefa_de_Estado_participa_en_ceremonia_de_la_Firma_de_la_Paz_entre_el_Gobierno_de_Colombia_y_las_FARC_E.P._%2829953487045%29.jpg 2x" width="235"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Jefa_de_Estado_participa_en_ceremonia_de_la_Firma_de_la_Paz_entre_el_Gobierno_de_Colombia_y_las_FARC_E.P._(29953487045).jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         President
         <a href="/wiki/Juan_Manuel_Santos" title="Juan Manuel Santos">
          Juan Manuel Santos
         </a>
         signed a
         <a href="/wiki/Colombian_peace_process" title="Colombian peace process">
          peace accord
         </a>
         .
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The administration of President
       <a href="/wiki/%C3%81lvaro_Uribe" title="Álvaro Uribe">
        Álvaro Uribe
       </a>
       (2002–10), adopted the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Democratic_security_policy" title="Democratic security policy">
        democratic security policy
       </a>
       which included an integrated
       <a href="/wiki/Counter-terrorism" title="Counter-terrorism">
        counter-terrorism
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Counter-insurgency" title="Counter-insurgency">
        counter-insurgency
       </a>
       campaign.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-118">
        <a href="#cite_note-118">
         [112]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The Government economic plan also promoted confidence in investors.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-119">
        <a href="#cite_note-119">
         [113]
        </a>
       </sup>
       As part of a controversial peace process the
       <a href="/wiki/United_Self-Defense_Forces_of_Colombia" title="United Self-Defense Forces of Colombia">
        AUC
       </a>
       (right-wing paramilitaries) as a formal organization had ceased to function.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CIAWFB_120-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-CIAWFB-120">
         [114]
        </a>
       </sup>
       In February 2008, millions of Colombians demonstrated against FARC and other outlawed groups.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-121">
        <a href="#cite_note-121">
         [115]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       After peace negotiations in
       <a href="/wiki/Cuba" title="Cuba">
        Cuba
       </a>
       , the
       <a href="/wiki/Government_of_Colombia" title="Government of Colombia">
        Colombian government
       </a>
       of President
       <a href="/wiki/Juan_Manuel_Santos" title="Juan Manuel Santos">
        Juan Manuel Santos
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Guerrilla" title="Guerrilla">
        guerrilla
       </a>
       of FARC-EP announced a final agreement to end the conflict.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-122">
        <a href="#cite_note-122">
         [116]
        </a>
       </sup>
       However, a
       <a href="/wiki/Colombian_peace_agreement_referendum,_2016" title="Colombian peace agreement referendum, 2016">
        referendum
       </a>
       to ratify the deal was unsuccessful.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-123">
        <a href="#cite_note-123">
         [117]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-124">
        <a href="#cite_note-124">
         [118]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Afterward, the Colombian government and the FARC signed a revised
       <a href="/wiki/Colombian_peace_process" title="Colombian peace process">
        peace deal
       </a>
       in November 2016,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-125">
        <a href="#cite_note-125">
         [119]
        </a>
       </sup>
       which the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Colombian_congress" title="Colombian congress">
        Colombian congress
       </a>
       approved.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-126">
        <a href="#cite_note-126">
         [120]
        </a>
       </sup>
       In 2016, President Santos was awarded the
       <a href="/wiki/2016_Nobel_Peace_Prize" title="2016 Nobel Peace Prize">
        Nobel Peace Prize
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-127">
        <a href="#cite_note-127">
         [121]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The Government began a process of attention and comprehensive reparation for victims of conflict.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-128">
        <a href="#cite_note-128">
         [122]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-129">
        <a href="#cite_note-129">
         [123]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Colombia shows modest progress in the struggle to defend human rights, as expressed by
       <a href="/wiki/Human_Rights_Watch" title="Human Rights Watch">
        HRW
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-130">
        <a href="#cite_note-130">
         [124]
        </a>
       </sup>
       A Special Jurisdiction for Peace has been created to investigate, clarify, prosecute and punish serious human rights violations and grave breaches of
       <a href="/wiki/International_humanitarian_law" title="International humanitarian law">
        international humanitarian law
       </a>
       which occurred during the armed conflict and to satisfy victims' right to
       <a href="/wiki/Justice" title="Justice">
        justice
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-131">
        <a href="#cite_note-131">
         [125]
        </a>
       </sup>
       During his visit to Colombia,
       <a href="/wiki/Pope_Francis" title="Pope Francis">
        Pope Francis
       </a>
       paid tribute to the victims of the conflict.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-132">
        <a href="#cite_note-132">
         [126]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       In terms of international relations, Colombia and Venezuela have agreed to restore
       <a href="/wiki/2010_Colombia%E2%80%93Venezuela_diplomatic_crisis" title="2010 Colombia–Venezuela diplomatic crisis">
        diplomatic relations
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-133">
        <a href="#cite_note-133">
         [127]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Latin America, with a long memory of
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_authoritarian_regimes_supported_by_the_United_States" title="List of authoritarian regimes supported by the United States">
        U.S. interventions
       </a>
       such as the infamous
       <a href="/wiki/Operation_Condor" title="Operation Condor">
        Operation Condor
       </a>
       , rejects US military threat against Venezuela.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-134">
        <a href="#cite_note-134">
         [128]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Colombia's Foreign Ministry said that all efforts to resolve
       <a href="/wiki/Crisis_in_Venezuela_(2012%E2%80%93present)" title="Crisis in Venezuela (2012–present)">
        Venezuela's crisis
       </a>
       should be peaceful and respect its sovereignty.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-135">
        <a href="#cite_note-135">
         [129]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Colombia has offered
       <a href="/wiki/Humanitarian_aid" title="Humanitarian aid">
        humanitarian support
       </a>
       with food and medicines to mitigate the shortage of supplies in Venezuela.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-136">
        <a href="#cite_note-136">
         [130]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Colombia proposed the idea of the
       <a href="/wiki/Sustainable_Development_Goals" title="Sustainable Development Goals">
        Sustainable Development Goals
       </a>
       and a final document was adopted by the
       <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">
        United Nations
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-137">
        <a href="#cite_note-137">
         [131]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Colombia with a very clean electricity generation matrix reaffirms its support for the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Paris_Climate_Agreement" title="Paris Climate Agreement">
        Paris Climate Agreement
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-138">
        <a href="#cite_note-138">
         [132]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Geography">
        Geography
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Geography_of_Colombia" title="Geography of Colombia">
        Geography of Colombia
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       See also:
       <a href="/wiki/Geology_of_Colombia" title="Geology of Colombia">
        Geology of Colombia
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_national_parks_of_Colombia" title="List of national parks of Colombia">
        List of national parks of Colombia
       </a>
       , and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_rivers_in_Colombia" title="List of rivers in Colombia">
        List of rivers in Colombia
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:237px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Mapa_de_Colombia_(relieve).svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2339" data-file-width="2072" height="265" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Mapa_de_Colombia_%28relieve%29.svg/235px-Mapa_de_Colombia_%28relieve%29.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Mapa_de_Colombia_%28relieve%29.svg/353px-Mapa_de_Colombia_%28relieve%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Mapa_de_Colombia_%28relieve%29.svg/470px-Mapa_de_Colombia_%28relieve%29.svg.png 2x" width="235"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Mapa_de_Colombia_(relieve).svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Relief map
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The geography of Colombia is characterized by its six main
       <a href="/wiki/Natural_regions_of_Colombia" title="Natural regions of Colombia">
        natural regions
       </a>
       that present their own unique characteristics, from the
       <a href="/wiki/Andes" title="Andes">
        Andes mountain range
       </a>
       region shared with Ecuador and Venezuela; the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pacific_Coast" title="Pacific Coast">
        Pacific coastal region
       </a>
       shared with Panama and Ecuador; the Caribbean coastal region shared with Venezuela and Panama; the
       <i>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Los_Llanos,_Venezuela" title="Los Llanos, Venezuela">
         Llanos
        </a>
       </i>
       (plains) shared with Venezuela; the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Amazon_Rainforest" title="Amazon Rainforest">
        Amazon Rainforest
       </a>
       region shared with Venezuela, Brazil, Peru and Ecuador; to the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Insular_Region_(Colombia)" title="Insular Region (Colombia)">
        insular area
       </a>
       , comprising islands in both the Atlantic and Pacific oceans.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Geography_of_Colombia_139-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Geography_of_Colombia-139">
         [133]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Colombia is bordered to the northwest by
       <a href="/wiki/Panama" title="Panama">
        Panama
       </a>
       ; to the east by
       <a href="/wiki/Venezuela" title="Venezuela">
        Venezuela
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">
        Brazil
       </a>
       ; to the south by
       <a href="/wiki/Ecuador" title="Ecuador">
        Ecuador
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Peru" title="Peru">
        Peru
       </a>
       ;
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Land_borders_12-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-Land_borders-12">
         [11]
        </a>
       </sup>
       it established its maritime boundaries with neighboring countries through seven agreements on the Caribbean Sea and three on the Pacific Ocean.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Maritime_borders_13-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-Maritime_borders-13">
         [12]
        </a>
       </sup>
       It lies between latitudes
       <a href="/wiki/12th_parallel_north" title="12th parallel north">
        12°N
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/4th_parallel_south" title="4th parallel south">
        4°S
       </a>
       , and longitudes
       <a href="/wiki/67th_meridian_west" title="67th meridian west">
        67°
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/79th_meridian_west" title="79th meridian west">
        79°W
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Colombia_koppen.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1314" data-file-width="765" height="378" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Colombia_koppen.svg/220px-Colombia_koppen.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Colombia_koppen.svg/330px-Colombia_koppen.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Colombia_koppen.svg/440px-Colombia_koppen.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Colombia_koppen.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Colombia map of
         <a href="/wiki/K%C3%B6ppen_climate_classification" title="Köppen climate classification">
          Köppen climate classification
         </a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       Part of the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pacific_Ring_of_Fire" title="Pacific Ring of Fire">
        Ring of Fire
       </a>
       , a region of the world subject to earthquakes and
       <a href="/wiki/Volcano" title="Volcano">
        volcanic eruptions
       </a>
       ,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Ring_of_Fire_140-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Ring_of_Fire-140">
         [134]
        </a>
       </sup>
       in the interior of Colombia the Andes are the prevailing geographical feature. Most of Colombia's population centers are located in these interior highlands. Beyond the
       <a href="/wiki/Colombian_Massif" title="Colombian Massif">
        Colombian Massif
       </a>
       (in the south-western departments of
       <a href="/wiki/Cauca_Department" title="Cauca Department">
        Cauca
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Nari%C3%B1o_Department" title="Nariño Department">
        Nariño
       </a>
       ) these are divided into three branches known as
       <i>
        cordilleras
       </i>
       (mountain ranges): the
       <a href="/wiki/Cordillera_Occidental_(Colombia)" title="Cordillera Occidental (Colombia)">
        Cordillera Occidental
       </a>
       , running adjacent to the Pacific coast and including the city of
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Santiago_de_Cali" title="Santiago de Cali">
        Cali
       </a>
       ; the
       <a href="/wiki/Cordillera_Central_(Colombia)" title="Cordillera Central (Colombia)">
        Cordillera Central
       </a>
       , running between the
       <a href="/wiki/Cauca_River" title="Cauca River">
        Cauca
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Magdalena_River" title="Magdalena River">
        Magdalena River
       </a>
       valleys (to the west and east respectively) and including the cities of
       <a href="/wiki/Medell%C3%ADn" title="Medellín">
        Medellín
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Manizales" title="Manizales">
        Manizales
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Pereira,_Colombia" title="Pereira, Colombia">
        Pereira
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Armenia,_Quind%C3%ADo" title="Armenia, Quindío">
        Armenia
       </a>
       ; and the
       <a href="/wiki/Cordillera_Oriental_(Colombia)" title="Cordillera Oriental (Colombia)">
        Cordillera Oriental
       </a>
       , extending north east to the
       <a href="/wiki/Guajira_Peninsula" title="Guajira Peninsula">
        Guajira Peninsula
       </a>
       and including Bogotá,
       <a href="/wiki/Bucaramanga" title="Bucaramanga">
        Bucaramanga
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/C%C3%BAcuta" title="Cúcuta">
        Cúcuta
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Geography_of_Colombia_139-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-Geography_of_Colombia-139">
         [133]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-populationbyregions_141-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-populationbyregions-141">
         [135]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Population_density_142-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Population_density-142">
         [136]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Peaks in the Cordillera Occidental exceed 4,700 m (15,420 ft), and in the Cordillera Central and Cordillera Oriental they reach 5,000 m (16,404 ft). At 2,600 m (8,530 ft), Bogotá is the highest city of its size in the world.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Geography_of_Colombia_139-2">
        <a href="#cite_note-Geography_of_Colombia-139">
         [133]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       East of the Andes lies the
       <a href="/wiki/Savanna" title="Savanna">
        savanna
       </a>
       of the
       <i>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Los_Llanos,_Venezuela" title="Los Llanos, Venezuela">
         Llanos
        </a>
       </i>
       , part of the
       <a href="/wiki/Orinoco" title="Orinoco">
        Orinoco River basin
       </a>
       , and, in the far south east, the
       <a href="/wiki/Jungle" title="Jungle">
        jungle
       </a>
       of the
       <a href="/wiki/Amazon_rainforest" title="Amazon rainforest">
        Amazon rainforest
       </a>
       . Together these lowlands comprise over half Colombia's territory, but they contain less than 6% of the population. To the north the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Caribbean_Region_of_Colombia" title="Caribbean Region of Colombia">
        Caribbean coast
       </a>
       , home to 21.9% of the population and the location of the major port cities of
       <a href="/wiki/Barranquilla" title="Barranquilla">
        Barranquilla
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Cartagena,_Colombia" title="Cartagena, Colombia">
        Cartagena
       </a>
       , generally consists of low-lying plains, but it also contains the
       <a href="/wiki/Sierra_Nevada_de_Santa_Marta" title="Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta">
        Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta
       </a>
       mountain range, which includes the country's tallest peaks (
       <a href="/wiki/Pico_Crist%C3%B3bal_Col%C3%B3n" title="Pico Cristóbal Colón">
        Pico Cristóbal Colón
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pico_Sim%C3%B3n_Bol%C3%ADvar" title="Pico Simón Bolívar">
        Pico Simón Bolívar
       </a>
       ), and the
       <a href="/wiki/La_Guajira_Desert" title="La Guajira Desert">
        La Guajira Desert
       </a>
       . By contrast the narrow and discontinuous
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pacific_Region_of_Colombia" title="Pacific Region of Colombia">
        Pacific coastal lowlands
       </a>
       , backed by the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Baud%C3%B3_Mountains" title="Baudó Mountains">
        Serranía de Baudó
       </a>
       mountains, are sparsely populated and covered in dense vegetation. The principal Pacific port is
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Buenaventura,_Colombia" title="Buenaventura, Colombia">
        Buenaventura
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Geography_of_Colombia_139-3">
        <a href="#cite_note-Geography_of_Colombia-139">
         [133]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-populationbyregions_141-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-populationbyregions-141">
         [135]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Population_density_142-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-Population_density-142">
         [136]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       The main rivers of Colombia are
       <a href="/wiki/Magdalena_River" title="Magdalena River">
        Magdalena
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Cauca_River" title="Cauca River">
        Cauca
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Guaviare_River" title="Guaviare River">
        Guaviare
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Atrato_River" title="Atrato River">
        Atrato
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Meta_River" title="Meta River">
        Meta
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Putumayo_River" title="Putumayo River">
        Putumayo
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Caquet%C3%A1_River" title="Caquetá River">
        Caquetá
       </a>
       . Colombia has four main drainage systems: the Pacific drain, the Caribbean drain, the Orinoco Basin and the Amazon Basin. The
       <a href="/wiki/Orinoco" title="Orinoco">
        Orinoco
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Amazon_River" title="Amazon River">
        Amazon
       </a>
       Rivers mark limits with Colombia to Venezuela and Peru respectively.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Hydrography_143-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Hydrography-143">
         [137]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Protected areas and the "National Park System" cover an area of about 14,268,224 hectares (142,682.24 km
       <sup>
        2
       </sup>
       ) and account for 12.77% of the Colombian territory.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-144">
        <a href="#cite_note-144">
         [138]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Compared to neighboring countries, rates of deforestation in Colombia are still relatively low.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-United_Nations_Deforestation_145-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-United_Nations_Deforestation-145">
         [139]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Colombia is the sixth country in the world by magnitude of total renewable freshwater supply, and still has large reserves of freshwater.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-worldwater_146-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-worldwater-146">
         [140]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Climate">
        Climate
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Climate_of_Colombia" title="Climate of Colombia">
        Climate of Colombia
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       The climate of Colombia is characterized for being
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Tropical" title="Tropical">
        tropical
       </a>
       presenting variations within
       <a href="/wiki/Natural_regions_of_Colombia" title="Natural regions of Colombia">
        six natural regions
       </a>
       and depending on the altitude, temperature,
       <a href="/wiki/Humidity" title="Humidity">
        humidity
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Wind" title="Wind">
        winds
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Rainfall" title="Rainfall">
        rainfall
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Thermal_floors_147-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Thermal_floors-147">
         [141]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The diversity of climate zones in Colombia is characterized for having
       <a href="/wiki/Tropical_rainforest" title="Tropical rainforest">
        tropical rainforests
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Savanna" title="Savanna">
        savannas
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Steppe" title="Steppe">
        steppes
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Desert" title="Desert">
        deserts
       </a>
       and mountain climate.
      </p>
      <p>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mountain_climate" title="Mountain climate">
        Mountain climate
       </a>
       is one of the unique features of the Andes and other high altitude reliefs where climate is determined by elevation. Below 1,000 meters (3,281 ft) in elevation is the
       <a href="/wiki/Tierra_caliente" title="Tierra caliente">
        warm altitudinal zone
       </a>
       , where
       <a href="/wiki/Temperature" title="Temperature">
        temperatures
       </a>
       are above 24 °C (75.2 °F). About 82.5% of the country's total area lies in the warm altitudinal zone. The
       <a href="/wiki/Tierra_templada" title="Tierra templada">
        temperate climate altitudinal zone
       </a>
       located between 1,001 and 2,000 meters (3,284 and 6,562 ft) is characterized for presenting an average temperature ranging between 17 and 24 °C (62.6 and 75.2 °F). The
       <a href="/wiki/Tierra_fr%C3%ADa" title="Tierra fría">
        cold climate
       </a>
       is present between 2,001 and 3,000 meters (6,565 and 9,843 ft) and the temperatures vary between 12 and 17 °C (53.6 and 62.6 °F). Beyond the cold land lie the alpine conditions of the forested zone and then the treeless grasslands of the
       <a href="/wiki/P%C3%A1ramo" title="Páramo">
        páramos
       </a>
       . Above 4,000 meters (13,123 ft), where temperatures are below freezing, the climate is
       <a href="/wiki/Tierra_helada" title="Tierra helada">
        glacial
       </a>
       , a zone of permanent snow and ice.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Thermal_floors_147-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-Thermal_floors-147">
         [141]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <ul class="gallery mw-gallery-packed">
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 162px">
        <div style="width: 162px">

          </div>

          </p>

          </div>
         </div>

          </p>
         </div>

       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 162px">

           </a>

           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Tota_Lake" title="Tota Lake">

           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 162px">
        <div style="width: 162px">

           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           <a href="/wiki/Desert_climate" title="Desert climate">
            Cold desert climate
           </a>
           near
           <a href="/wiki/Villa_de_Leyva" title="Villa de Leyva">
            Villa de Leyva
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 181.33333333333px">
        <div style="width: 181.33333333333px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 179.33333333333px;">
          <div style="margin:0px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Chiribiquete_view.jpg">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="369" data-file-width="550" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/10/Chiribiquete_view.jpg/269px-Chiribiquete_view.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/10/Chiribiquete_view.jpg/403px-Chiribiquete_view.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/10/Chiribiquete_view.jpg/537px-Chiribiquete_view.jpg 2x" width="180"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           <a href="/wiki/Tropical_and_subtropical_moist_broadleaf_forests" title="Tropical and subtropical moist broadleaf forests">
            Tropical wet climate
           </a>
           in the
           <a href="/wiki/Tepui" title="Tepui">
            tepuis
           </a>
           of the
           <a href="/wiki/Serran%C3%ADa_de_Chiribiquete" title="Serranía de Chiribiquete">
            Serranía de Chiribiquete
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 162px">
        <div style="width: 162px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 160px;">
          <div style="margin:0px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Paisaje_rural_en_Tinjac%C3%A1.jpg">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="768" data-file-width="1024" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Paisaje_rural_en_Tinjac%C3%A1.jpg/240px-Paisaje_rural_en_Tinjac%C3%A1.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Paisaje_rural_en_Tinjac%C3%A1.jpg/360px-Paisaje_rural_en_Tinjac%C3%A1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Paisaje_rural_en_Tinjac%C3%A1.jpg/480px-Paisaje_rural_en_Tinjac%C3%A1.jpg 2x" width="160"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_climate" title="Mediterranean climate">
            Mediterranean climate
           </a>
           in
           <a href="/wiki/Boyac%C3%A1_Department" title="Boyacá Department">
            Boyacá Department
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 184px">
        <div style="width: 184px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 182px;">
          <div style="margin:0px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Sunset_on_the_Amazon_(7613489930).jpg">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="1170" data-file-width="1770" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b5/Sunset_on_the_Amazon_%287613489930%29.jpg/273px-Sunset_on_the_Amazon_%287613489930%29.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b5/Sunset_on_the_Amazon_%287613489930%29.jpg/409px-Sunset_on_the_Amazon_%287613489930%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b5/Sunset_on_the_Amazon_%287613489930%29.jpg/545px-Sunset_on_the_Amazon_%287613489930%29.jpg 2x" width="182"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           <a href="/wiki/Tropical_rainforest_climate" title="Tropical rainforest climate">
            Tropical rainforest climate
           </a>
           in the
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Amazon_Basin" title="Amazon Basin">
            Amazon Rainforest
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 182.66666666667px">
        <div style="width: 182.66666666667px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 180.66666666667px;">
          <div style="margin:0px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:NP_Llanos36_lo_(5853389005).jpg">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="2848" data-file-width="4288" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/51/NP_Llanos36_lo_%285853389005%29.jpg/271px-NP_Llanos36_lo_%285853389005%29.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/51/NP_Llanos36_lo_%285853389005%29.jpg/407px-NP_Llanos36_lo_%285853389005%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/51/NP_Llanos36_lo_%285853389005%29.jpg/542px-NP_Llanos36_lo_%285853389005%29.jpg 2x" width="181"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           <a href="/wiki/Tropical_savanna_climate" title="Tropical savanna climate">
            Tropical savanna climate
           </a>
           in
           <a href="/wiki/Los_Llanos_(South_America)" title="Los Llanos (South America)">

           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 162px">
        <div style="width: 162px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 160px;">
          <div style="margin:0px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Cabo_de_La_vela.JPG">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="2736" data-file-width="3648" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Cabo_de_La_vela.JPG/240px-Cabo_de_La_vela.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Cabo_de_La_vela.JPG/360px-Cabo_de_La_vela.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Cabo_de_La_vela.JPG/480px-Cabo_de_La_vela.JPG 2x" width="160"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           <a href="/wiki/Desert_climate" title="Desert climate">
            Hot desert climate
           </a>
           in the
           <a href="/wiki/Guajira_Peninsula" title="Guajira Peninsula">
            Guajira Peninsula
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 182.66666666667px">
        <div style="width: 182.66666666667px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 180.66666666667px;">
          <div style="margin:0px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Johny_Cay.jpg">

           </a>
          </div>

            Tropical wet and dry climate
           </a>
           in
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/San_Andr%C3%A9s_y_Providencia" title="San Andrés y Providencia">
            San Andrés y Providencia
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 182.66666666667px">
        <div style="width: 182.66666666667px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 180.66666666667px;">
          <div style="margin:0px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:CA%C3%91O_CRISTALES_%E2%80%93_LOS_OCHOS_01.jpg">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="2497" data-file-width="3752" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/CA%C3%91O_CRISTALES_%E2%80%93_LOS_OCHOS_01.jpg/271px-CA%C3%91O_CRISTALES_%E2%80%93_LOS_OCHOS_01.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/CA%C3%91O_CRISTALES_%E2%80%93_LOS_OCHOS_01.jpg/406px-CA%C3%91O_CRISTALES_%E2%80%93_LOS_OCHOS_01.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/CA%C3%91O_CRISTALES_%E2%80%93_LOS_OCHOS_01.jpg/541px-CA%C3%91O_CRISTALES_%E2%80%93_LOS_OCHOS_01.jpg 2x" width="181"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           <a href="/wiki/Tropical_climate" title="Tropical climate">
            Warm and wet climate
           </a>
           in
           <a href="/wiki/Ca%C3%B1o_Cristales" title="Caño Cristales">
            Caño Cristales
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 194px">
        <div style="width: 194px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 192px;">
          <div style="margin:0px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Munchique2.jpg">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="641" data-file-width="1024" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Munchique2.jpg/288px-Munchique2.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Munchique2.jpg/432px-Munchique2.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Munchique2.jpg/575px-Munchique2.jpg 2x" width="192"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mountain_climate" title="Mountain climate">
            Mountain climate
           </a>
           in the
           <a href="/wiki/Cordillera_Occidental_(Colombia)" title="Cordillera Occidental (Colombia)">
            Cordillera Occidental
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Biodiversity">
        Biodiversity
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:ChlorochrysaNitidissimaKeulemans.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="3014" data-file-width="1887" height="272" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ac/ChlorochrysaNitidissimaKeulemans.jpg/170px-ChlorochrysaNitidissimaKeulemans.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ac/ChlorochrysaNitidissimaKeulemans.jpg/255px-ChlorochrysaNitidissimaKeulemans.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ac/ChlorochrysaNitidissimaKeulemans.jpg/340px-ChlorochrysaNitidissimaKeulemans.jpg 2x" width="170"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:ChlorochrysaNitidissimaKeulemans.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         <i>
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chlorochrysa_nitidissima" title="Chlorochrysa nitidissima">
           Chlorochrysa nitidissima
          </a>
         </i>
         . Colombia is home to more bird species than any other country in the world.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Biodiversity_of_Colombia" title="Biodiversity of Colombia">
        Biodiversity of Colombia
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       See also:
       <a href="/wiki/Fauna_of_Colombia" title="Fauna of Colombia">
        Fauna of Colombia
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Flora_of_Colombia" title="Flora of Colombia">
        Flora of Colombia
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Cattleya_trianae_tipo_Baronessa.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2400" data-file-width="3200" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Cattleya_trianae_tipo_Baronessa.jpg/220px-Cattleya_trianae_tipo_Baronessa.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Cattleya_trianae_tipo_Baronessa.jpg/330px-Cattleya_trianae_tipo_Baronessa.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Cattleya_trianae_tipo_Baronessa.jpg/440px-Cattleya_trianae_tipo_Baronessa.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Cattleya_trianae_tipo_Baronessa.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The national flower of Colombia is the
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Endemic" title="Endemic">
          endemic
         </a>
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Orchid" title="Orchid">
          orchid
         </a>
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Cattleya_trianae" title="Cattleya trianae">
           Cattleya trianae
          </a>
         </i>
         , which was named after the Colombian botanist and physician
         <a href="/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Jer%C3%B3nimo_Triana" title="José Jerónimo Triana">
          José Jerónimo Triana
         </a>
         .
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-148">
          <a href="#cite_note-148">
           [142]
          </a>
         </sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       Colombia is one of the
       <a href="/wiki/Megadiverse_countries" title="Megadiverse countries">
        megadiverse countries
       </a>
       in
       <a href="/wiki/Biodiversity" title="Biodiversity">
        biodiversity
       </a>
       ,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-149">
        <a href="#cite_note-149">
         [143]
        </a>
       </sup>
       ranking first in
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_birds_of_Colombia" title="List of birds of Colombia">
        bird species
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Bird_Species_150-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Bird_Species-150">
         [144]
        </a>
       </sup>
       As for plants, the country has between 40,000 and 45,000 plant
       <a href="/wiki/Species" title="Species">
        species
       </a>
       , equivalent to 10 or 20% of total global species, which is even more remarkable given that Colombia is considered a country of intermediate size.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-151">
        <a href="#cite_note-151">
         [145]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Colombia is the second most biodiverse country in the world, lagging only after Brazil which is approximately 7 times bigger.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Biodiversity_of_Colombia_15-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-Biodiversity_of_Colombia-15">
         [14]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Colombia is the country in the planet more characterized by a high biodiversity, with the highest rate of species by area unit worldwide and it has the largest number of
       <a href="/wiki/Endemism" title="Endemism">
        endemisms
       </a>
       (species that are not found naturally anywhere else) of any country. About 10% of the species of the
       <a href="/wiki/Earth" title="Earth">
        Earth
       </a>
       live in Colombia, including over 1,900 species of bird, more than in Europe and North America combined, Colombia has 10% of the world's
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_mammals_of_Colombia" title="List of mammals of Colombia">
        mammals
       </a>
       species, 14% of the
       <a href="/wiki/Amphibian" title="Amphibian">
        amphibian
       </a>
       species and 18% of the
       <a href="/wiki/Endemic_birds_of_Colombia" title="Endemic birds of Colombia">
        bird
       </a>
       species of the world.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-DIVERSITY_OF_SPECIES_IN_COLOMBIA_152-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-DIVERSITY_OF_SPECIES_IN_COLOMBIA-152">
         [146]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Colombia has about 2,000 species of
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Marine_fish" title="Marine fish">
        marine fish
       </a>
       and is the second most diverse country in
       <a href="/wiki/Freshwater_fish" title="Freshwater fish">
        freshwater fish
       </a>
       . Colombia is the country with more endemic species of
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_butterflies_of_Colombia" title="List of butterflies of Colombia">
        butterflies
       </a>
       , number 1 in terms of
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Orchid" title="Orchid">
        orchid
       </a>
       species and approximately 7,000 species of
       <a href="/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">
        beetles
       </a>
       . Colombia is second in the number of amphibian species and is the third most diverse country in
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_reptiles_of_Colombia" title="List of reptiles of Colombia">
        reptiles
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Arecaceae" title="Arecaceae">
        palms
       </a>
       . There are about 1,900 species of
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mollusk" title="Mollusk">
        mollusks
       </a>
       and according to estimates there are about 300,000 species of
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Invertebrates" title="Invertebrates">
        invertebrates
       </a>
       in the country. In Colombia there are 32 terrestrial
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Biomes" title="Biomes">
        biomes
       </a>
       and 314 types of
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ecosystems" title="Ecosystems">
        ecosystems
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-153">
        <a href="#cite_note-153">
         [147]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-humboldt_154-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-humboldt-154">
         [148]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Government_and_politics">
        Government and politics
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Government_of_Colombia" title="Government of Colombia">
        Government of Colombia
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       See also:
       <a href="/wiki/Colombian_Constitution_of_1991" title="Colombian Constitution of 1991">
        Colombian Constitution of 1991
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Lado_sur_Casa_de_Nari%C3%B1o.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="539" data-file-width="960" height="140" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Lado_sur_Casa_de_Nari%C3%B1o.jpg/250px-Lado_sur_Casa_de_Nari%C3%B1o.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Lado_sur_Casa_de_Nari%C3%B1o.jpg/375px-Lado_sur_Casa_de_Nari%C3%B1o.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Lado_sur_Casa_de_Nari%C3%B1o.jpg/500px-Lado_sur_Casa_de_Nari%C3%B1o.jpg 2x" width="250"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Lado_sur_Casa_de_Nari%C3%B1o.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         <a href="/wiki/Casa_de_Nari%C3%B1o" title="Casa de Nariño">
          Casa de Nariño
         </a>
         is the official home and principal workplace of the
         <a href="/wiki/President_of_Colombia" title="President of Colombia">
          President of Colombia
         </a>
         .
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The government of Colombia takes place within the framework of a
       <a href="/wiki/Presidential_system" title="Presidential system">
        presidential
       </a>
       <a href="/wiki/Participatory_democracy" title="Participatory democracy">
        participatory democratic
       </a>
       republic as established in the Constitution of 1991.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Colombian_Constitution_of_1991_117-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-Colombian_Constitution_of_1991-117">
         [111]
        </a>
       </sup>
       In accordance with the principle of
       <a href="/wiki/Separation_of_powers" title="Separation of powers">
        separation of powers
       </a>
       , government is divided into three branches: the executive branch, the legislative branch and the judicial branch.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-155">
        <a href="#cite_note-155">
         [149]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       As the head of the executive branch, the
       <a href="/wiki/President_of_Colombia" title="President of Colombia">
        President of Colombia
       </a>
       serves as both
       <a href="/wiki/Head_of_state" title="Head of state">
        head of state
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Head_of_government" title="Head of government">
        head of government
       </a>
       , followed by the
       <a href="/wiki/Vice_President_of_Colombia" title="Vice President of Colombia">
        Vice President
       </a>
       and the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Council_of_Ministers_of_the_Republic_of_Colombia" title="Council of Ministers of the Republic of Colombia">
        Council of Ministers
       </a>
       . The president is elected by popular vote to serve four-year term (In 2015, Colombia's Congress approved the repeal of a 2004 constitutional amendment that eliminated the one-term limit for presidents).
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-156">
        <a href="#cite_note-156">
         [150]
        </a>
       </sup>
       At the provincial level executive power is vested in
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_Colombian_Department_Governors" title="List of Colombian Department Governors">
        department governors
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Municipalities_of_Colombia" title="Municipalities of Colombia">
        municipal mayors
       </a>
       and local administrators for smaller administrative subdivisions, such as
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Corregimientos_of_Colombia" title="Corregimientos of Colombia">
         corregimientos
        </a>
       </i>
       or
       <i>
        comunas
       </i>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-157">
        <a href="#cite_note-157">
         [151]
        </a>
       </sup>
       All regional elections are held one year and five months after the presidential election.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Government_158-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Government-158">
         [152]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-159">
        <a href="#cite_note-159">
         [153]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       The legislative branch of government is represented nationally by the
       <a href="/wiki/Congress_of_Colombia" title="Congress of Colombia">
        Congress
       </a>
       , a bicameral institution comprising a 166-seat
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Representatives_of_Colombia" title="Chamber of Representatives of Colombia">
        Chamber of Representatives
       </a>
       and a 102-seat
       <a href="/wiki/Senate_of_Colombia" title="Senate of Colombia">
        Senate
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-160">
        <a href="#cite_note-160">
         [154]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-161">
        <a href="#cite_note-161">
         [155]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The Senate is elected nationally and the Chamber of Representatives is elected in electoral districts.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-162">
        <a href="#cite_note-162">
         [156]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Members of both houses are elected to serve four-year terms two months before the president, also by popular vote.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-163">
        <a href="#cite_note-163">
         [157]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Nuevopalaciodejusticia.JPG">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2304" data-file-width="3072" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Nuevopalaciodejusticia.JPG/220px-Nuevopalaciodejusticia.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Nuevopalaciodejusticia.JPG/330px-Nuevopalaciodejusticia.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Nuevopalaciodejusticia.JPG/440px-Nuevopalaciodejusticia.JPG 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Nuevopalaciodejusticia.JPG" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Colombia's Palace of Justice
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The judicial branch is headed by
       <a href="/wiki/Judiciary_of_Colombia" title="Judiciary of Colombia">
        four high courts
       </a>
       ,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-164">
        <a href="#cite_note-164">
         [158]
        </a>
       </sup>
       consisting of the
       <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_Justice_of_Colombia" title="Supreme Court of Justice of Colombia">
        Supreme Court
       </a>
       which deals with penal and civil matters, the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Council_of_State_of_Colombia" title="Council of State of Colombia">
        Council of State
       </a>
       , which has special responsibility for
       <a href="/wiki/Administrative_law" title="Administrative law">
        administrative law
       </a>
       and also provides legal advice to the executive, the
       <a href="/wiki/Constitutional_Court_of_Colombia" title="Constitutional Court of Colombia">
        Constitutional Court
       </a>
       , responsible for assuring the integrity of the Colombian constitution, and the
       <a href="/wiki/Superior_Council_of_Judicature" title="Superior Council of Judicature">
        Superior Council of Judicature
       </a>
       , responsible for auditing the judicial branch.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-165">
        <a href="#cite_note-165">
         [159]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Colombia operates a system of
       <a href="/wiki/Civil_law_(legal_system)" title="Civil law (legal system)">
        civil law
       </a>
       , which since 2005 has been applied through an
       <a href="/wiki/Adversarial_system" title="Adversarial system">
        adversarial system
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       Despite a number of controversies, the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Democratic_security_policy" title="Democratic security policy">
        democratic security policy
       </a>
       has ensured that former President
       <a href="/wiki/%C3%81lvaro_Uribe" title="Álvaro Uribe">
        Uribe
       </a>
       remained popular among Colombian people, with his approval rating peaking at 76%, according to a poll in 2009.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-166">
        <a href="#cite_note-166">
         [160]
        </a>
       </sup>
       However, having served two terms, he was constitutionally barred from seeking re-election in 2010.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-167">
        <a href="#cite_note-167">
         [161]
        </a>
       </sup>
       In the run-off elections on 20 June 2010 the former Minister of defense
       <a href="/wiki/Juan_Manuel_Santos" title="Juan Manuel Santos">
        Juan Manuel Santos
       </a>
       won with 69% of the vote against the second most popular candidate,
       <a href="/wiki/Antanas_Mockus" title="Antanas Mockus">
        Antanas Mockus
       </a>
       . A second round was required since no candidate received over the 50% winning threshold of votes.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-168">
        <a href="#cite_note-168">
         [162]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Santos won nearly 51% of the vote in second-round elections on 15 June 2014, beating right-wing rival
       <a href="/wiki/%C3%93scar_Iv%C3%A1n_Zuluaga" title="Óscar Iván Zuluaga">
        Óscar Iván Zuluaga
       </a>
       , who won 45%. His term as Colombia's president runs for four years beginning 7 August 2014.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Resultados_elecciones_169-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Resultados_elecciones-169">
         [163]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Foreign_affairs">
        Foreign affairs
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_Colombia" title="Foreign relations of Colombia">
        Foreign relations of Colombia
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       See also:
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Diplomatic_missions_of_Colombia" title="Diplomatic missions of Colombia">
        Diplomatic missions of Colombia
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:VII_Cumbre_de_la_Alianza_del_Pac%C3%ADfico,_Santiago_de_Cali.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1214" data-file-width="2031" height="132" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e9/VII_Cumbre_de_la_Alianza_del_Pac%C3%ADfico%2C_Santiago_de_Cali.jpg/220px-VII_Cumbre_de_la_Alianza_del_Pac%C3%ADfico%2C_Santiago_de_Cali.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e9/VII_Cumbre_de_la_Alianza_del_Pac%C3%ADfico%2C_Santiago_de_Cali.jpg/330px-VII_Cumbre_de_la_Alianza_del_Pac%C3%ADfico%2C_Santiago_de_Cali.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e9/VII_Cumbre_de_la_Alianza_del_Pac%C3%ADfico%2C_Santiago_de_Cali.jpg/440px-VII_Cumbre_de_la_Alianza_del_Pac%C3%ADfico%2C_Santiago_de_Cali.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:VII_Cumbre_de_la_Alianza_del_Pac%C3%ADfico,_Santiago_de_Cali.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The VII Summit of the
         <a href="/wiki/Pacific_Alliance" title="Pacific Alliance">
          Pacific Alliance
         </a>
         : President of Colombia,
         <a href="/wiki/Juan_Manuel_Santos" title="Juan Manuel Santos">
          Juan Manuel Santos
         </a>
         is second from the left.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The foreign affairs of Colombia are headed by the President, as head of state, and managed by the
       <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Colombia)" title="Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Colombia)">
        Minister of Foreign Affairs
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-The_foreign_affairs_170-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-The_foreign_affairs-170">
         [164]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Colombia has diplomatic missions in all continents.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-171">
        <a href="#cite_note-171">
         [165]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Colombia was one of the 4 founding members of the
       <a href="/wiki/Pacific_Alliance" title="Pacific Alliance">
        Pacific Alliance
       </a>
       , which is a political, economic and co-operative integration mechanism that promotes the free circulation of goods, services, capital and persons between the members, as well as a common stock exchange and joint embassies in several countries.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-The_Pacific_Alliance_172-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-The_Pacific_Alliance-172">
         [166]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Colombia is also a member of the
       <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">
        United Nations
       </a>
       , the
       <a href="/wiki/World_Trade_Organization" title="World Trade Organization">
        World Trade Organization
       </a>
       , the
       <a href="/wiki/Organization_of_American_States" title="Organization of American States">
        Organization of American States
       </a>
       , the
       <a href="/wiki/Organization_of_Ibero-American_States" title="Organization of Ibero-American States">
        Organization of Ibero-American States
       </a>
       , the
       <a href="/wiki/Union_of_South_American_Nations" title="Union of South American Nations">
        Union of South American Nations
       </a>
       and the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Andean_Community_of_Nations" title="Andean Community of Nations">
        Andean Community of Nations
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-173">
        <a href="#cite_note-173">
         [167]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-174">
        <a href="#cite_note-174">
         [168]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-175">
        <a href="#cite_note-175">
         [169]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-176">
        <a href="#cite_note-176">
         [170]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Colombia is a global partner of
       <a href="/wiki/NATO" title="NATO">
        NATO
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-177">
        <a href="#cite_note-177">
         [171]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Colombia is currently in the accession process with the
       <a href="/wiki/OECD" title="OECD">
        OECD
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-178">
        <a href="#cite_note-178">
         [172]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Military">
        Military
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Military_of_Colombia" title="Military of Colombia">
        Military of Colombia
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Colombian_Air_Force_Sikorsky_UH-60L_Arp%C3%ADa_III_(S-70A-41)_Ram%C3%ADrez-1.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1333" data-file-width="2000" height="147" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/Colombian_Air_Force_Sikorsky_UH-60L_Arp%C3%ADa_III_%28S-70A-41%29_Ram%C3%ADrez-1.jpg/220px-Colombian_Air_Force_Sikorsky_UH-60L_Arp%C3%ADa_III_%28S-70A-41%29_Ram%C3%ADrez-1.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/Colombian_Air_Force_Sikorsky_UH-60L_Arp%C3%ADa_III_%28S-70A-41%29_Ram%C3%ADrez-1.jpg/330px-Colombian_Air_Force_Sikorsky_UH-60L_Arp%C3%ADa_III_%28S-70A-41%29_Ram%C3%ADrez-1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/Colombian_Air_Force_Sikorsky_UH-60L_Arp%C3%ADa_III_%28S-70A-41%29_Ram%C3%ADrez-1.jpg/440px-Colombian_Air_Force_Sikorsky_UH-60L_Arp%C3%ADa_III_%28S-70A-41%29_Ram%C3%ADrez-1.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Colombian_Air_Force_Sikorsky_UH-60L_Arp%C3%ADa_III_(S-70A-41)_Ram%C3%ADrez-1.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         <a href="/wiki/Sikorsky_UH-60_Black_Hawk" title="Sikorsky UH-60 Black Hawk">
          Arpía III
         </a>
         of the
         <a href="/wiki/Colombian_Air_Force" title="Colombian Air Force">
          Colombian Air Force
         </a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The executive branch of government is responsible for managing the defense of Colombia, with the President
       <a href="/wiki/Commander-in-chief" title="Commander-in-chief">
        commander-in-chief
       </a>
       of the armed forces. The
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ministry_of_National_Defence_(Colombia)" title="Ministry of National Defence (Colombia)">
        Ministry of Defence
       </a>
       exercises day-to-day control of the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Military_of_Colombia" title="Military of Colombia">
        military
       </a>
       and the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Colombian_National_Police" title="Colombian National Police">
        Colombian National Police
       </a>
       . Colombia has 455,461 active military personnel.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-179">
        <a href="#cite_note-179">
         [173]
        </a>
       </sup>
       And in 2016 3.4% of the country's GDP went towards military expenditure, placing it 24th in the world. Colombia's armed forces are the largest in Latin America, and it is the second largest spender on its military after Brazil.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-180">
        <a href="#cite_note-180">
         [174]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-181">
        <a href="#cite_note-181">
         [175]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       The Colombian military is divided into three branches: the
       <a href="/wiki/National_Army_of_Colombia" title="National Army of Colombia">
        National Army of Colombia
       </a>
       ; the
       <a href="/wiki/Colombian_Air_Force" title="Colombian Air Force">
        Colombian Air Force
       </a>
       ; and the
       <a href="/wiki/Colombian_Navy" title="Colombian Navy">
        Colombian Navy
       </a>
       . The National Police functions as a
       <a href="/wiki/Gendarmerie" title="Gendarmerie">
        gendarmerie
       </a>
       , operating independently from the military as the law enforcement agency for the entire country. Each of these operates with their own intelligence apparatus separate from the
       <a href="/wiki/National_Intelligence_Directorate_(Colombia)" title="National Intelligence Directorate (Colombia)">
        National Intelligence Directorate
       </a>
       (DNI, in Spanish).
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-The_Colombian_military_182-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-The_Colombian_military-182">
         [176]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       The National Army is formed by divisions, brigades, special brigades and special units;
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-The_National_Army_183-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-The_National_Army-183">
         [177]
        </a>
       </sup>
       the Colombian Navy by the
       <a href="/wiki/Colombian_Naval_Infantry" title="Colombian Naval Infantry">
        Naval Infantry
       </a>
       , the Naval Force of the Caribbean, the Naval Force of the Pacific, the Naval Force of the South, the Naval Force of the East, Colombia Coast Guards, Naval Aviation and the Specific Command of San Andres y Providencia;
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-the_National_Armada_184-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-the_National_Armada-184">
         [178]
        </a>
       </sup>
       and the Air Force by 15 air units.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-The_Air_Force_185-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-The_Air_Force-185">
         [179]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The National Police has a presence in all municipalities.
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Administrative_divisions">
        Administrative divisions
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main articles:
       <a href="/wiki/Departments_of_Colombia" title="Departments of Colombia">
        Departments of Colombia
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Municipalities_of_Colombia" title="Municipalities of Colombia">
        Municipalities of Colombia
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       See also:
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Colombia" title="List of cities in Colombia">
        List of cities in Colombia
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Corregimientos_of_Colombia" title="Corregimientos of Colombia">
        Corregimientos of Colombia
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       Colombia is divided into 32
       <a href="/wiki/Departments_of_Colombia" title="Departments of Colombia">
        departments
       </a>
       and one
       <a href="/wiki/Bogot%C3%A1" title="Bogotá">
        capital district
       </a>
       , which is treated as a department (Bogotá also serves as the capital of the
       <a href="/wiki/Cundinamarca_Department" title="Cundinamarca Department">
        department of Cundinamarca
       </a>
       ). Departments are subdivided into
       <a href="/wiki/Municipalities_of_Colombia" title="Municipalities of Colombia">
        municipalities
       </a>
       , each of which is assigned a municipal seat, and municipalities are in turn subdivided into
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Corregimientos_of_Colombia" title="Corregimientos of Colombia">
         corregimientos
        </a>
       </i>
       in rural areas and into
       <i>
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Comunas_of_Colombia&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Comunas of Colombia (page does not exist)">
         comunas
        </a>
       </i>
       in urban areas. Each department has a local government with a governor and assembly directly elected to four-year terms, and each municipality is headed by a mayor and council. There is a popularly elected local administrative board in each of the
       <i>
        corregimientos
       </i>
       or
       <i>
        comunas
       </i>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Administrative_divisions_186-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Administrative_divisions-186">
         [180]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Concerning_the_territorial_organization_187-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Concerning_the_territorial_organization-187">
         [181]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-188">
        <a href="#cite_note-188">
         [182]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-189">
        <a href="#cite_note-189">
         [183]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       In addition to the capital four other cities have been designated
       <a href="/wiki/Districts_of_Colombia" title="Districts of Colombia">
        districts
       </a>
       (in effect special municipalities), on the basis of special distinguishing features. These are
       <a href="/wiki/Barranquilla" title="Barranquilla">
        Barranquilla
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Cartagena,_Colombia" title="Cartagena, Colombia">
        Cartagena
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Santa_Marta" title="Santa Marta">
        Santa Marta
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Buenaventura,_Colombia" title="Buenaventura, Colombia">
        Buenaventura
       </a>
       . Some departments have local administrative subdivisions, where towns have a large concentration of population and municipalities are near each other (for example in Antioquia and Cundinamarca). Where departments have a low population (for example Amazonas, Vaupés and Vichada), special administrative divisions are employed, such as "department
       <i>
        corregimientos
       </i>
       ", which are a hybrid of a municipality and a
       <i>
        corregimiento
       </i>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Administrative_divisions_186-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-Administrative_divisions-186">
         [180]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Concerning_the_territorial_organization_187-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-Concerning_the_territorial_organization-187">
         [181]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       <small>
        Click on a department on the map below to go to its article.
       </small>
      </p>
      <div class="floatleft">
       <div class="noresize" style="height: 512px; width: 400px; ">
        <map name="ImageMap_1_2056891684">
         <area alt="La Guajira Department" coords="198,45,217,64,268,21,262,8,253,7,237,14,231,26,196,43" href="/wiki/La_Guajira_Department" shape="poly" title="La Guajira Department"/>
         <area alt="Magdalena Department" coords="177,40,194,43,193,54,195,64,181,71,178,78,186,89,177,93,184,108,170,102,160,91,155,74,160,48,180,41" href="/wiki/Magdalena_Department" shape="poly" title="Magdalena Department"/>
         <area alt="Atlántico Department" coords="158,48,154,69,145,59,130,52,127,46,157,26,162,32,157,50" href="/wiki/Atl%C3%A1ntico_Department" shape="poly" title="Atlántico Department"/>
         <area alt="Cesar Department" coords="195,54,214,70,209,91,200,102,195,125,201,140,198,145,191,144,188,112,189,105,181,96,190,92,183,77,187,71,197,66,195,54" href="/wiki/Cesar_Department" shape="poly" title="Cesar Department"/>
         <area alt="Bolívar Department" coords="140,59,152,74,156,79,158,95,173,108,184,116,185,136,183,152,179,165,173,169,172,156,166,157,168,149,166,139,161,133,165,130,164,111,156,105,154,97,143,88,139,81,136,69,141,60" href="/wiki/Bol%C3%ADvar_Department" shape="poly" title="Bolívar Department"/>
         <area alt="Norte de Santander Department" coords="204,107,200,124,204,137,202,149,198,151,210,151,216,160,218,169,227,173,238,168,236,160,228,158,228,141,231,137,220,115,218,107,210,105,203,108" href="/wiki/Norte_de_Santander_Department" shape="poly" title="Norte de Santander Department"/>
         <area alt="Sucre Department" coords="136,81,149,98,155,108,161,112,162,129,158,128,152,126,147,127,140,120,140,114,146,112,145,107,132,97,134,79" href="/wiki/Sucre_Department" shape="poly" title="Sucre Department"/>
         <area alt="Córdoba Department" coords="128,97,142,111,140,118,146,128,155,127,158,132,149,139,142,142,133,148,126,157,110,157,107,145,118,127,111,118,112,113,122,99,128,97" href="/wiki/C%C3%B3rdoba_Department" shape="poly" title="Córdoba Department"/>
